block.p: Roslyn Bancorp Sells Its Mortgage Subsidiary

Roslyn Bancorp Sells Its Mortgage Subsidiary

Calling the home mortgage market a ''commodity business with thin profit margins and increasing capital commitments,'' Roslyn Bancorp (Nasdaq: RSLYN) announced Monday that it was selling its Roslyn National Mortgage Corporation for $200,000 and a transfer of obligations to American Home Mortgage Holdings of New York. Roslyn will take a $7.6 million charge against third-quarter.
The company will eliminate 130 of the 207 jobs at the mortgage subsidiary, said Joseph L. Mancino, its president and chief executive.
The move will allow the company to concentrate on it 24 Roslyn Savings Bank branches and on its business-to-business products like construction and real estate loans, Mr. Mancino said.
Heinz and Hain Celestial To Market Soy Products
The H. J. Heinz Company has announced it will join with the Hain Celestial Group (Nasdaq: HAIN) of Uniondale to introduce new soy-based dairy-replacement products.

The soy products will be marketed as Health Valley Great Awakenings. The Hain Food Group, the parent company, acquired the Health Valley brand in May 1999; Great Awakenings is a new Heinz trademark developed especially for this product line.
The companies also announced that Heinz had begun distributing Hain products to buyers' club discount stores.
Melville Ad Agency Planning to Merge
Greenstone/Roberts Advertising Inc. (OTCBB:GRRI) of Melville is planning to merge with Kupper Parker Communications Inc. of St. Louis, best known for its work for Anheuser-Busch.
Kupper Parker, which has about 200 employees in six offices in the United States, would acquire 88 percent of Greenstone/Roberts, which has 28 employees.

The combined companies will have billings of about $150 million a year. The proposed merger must be approved by the Securities and Exchange Commission and then by Greenstone/Roberts stockholders in voting on Sept. 29.
